intro: Leucopogon alternifolius, commonly known as the alternate-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in sandy or rocky habitats. Its leaves are alternate, narrow, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are usually pink or white. It is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its native range.
